Summary: Orange balls scattered in the sky that got into a formation and dance into infinity
divs: sighting detailsthis event happened in the early 1960's in the wissinoming section of philadelphia. around torresdale and harbison avenues. while walking home from a store about 8\9 o'clock in the evening i happened to look at the sky in the east, toward new jersey. seven or eight bright orange balls caught my attention. they were sort of scattered in the sky, no particular formation to them. while looking at them for a few seconds i thought "what in the world is that". this thought no sooner entered my mind when to my amazement they all got together to form a "v" and danced eastwardly through the sky to infinity. the whole incedent took less than 30 seconds. as you can tell from the dates this is something i'll never forget. as this was happening i could feel the hairs on the back of my neck stand up. i have never seen anything like that since.
